svg.text: Week in Ethereum News - July 13 2024
July 13 2024

title: "Week in Ethereum News
July 13, 2024" date: "2024-07-13"
Eth News and Links
Multiple domains compromised, SEC drops Paxos BUSD case, Devcon ticket sales open, Alex Pertsev denied bail and Roman Storm granted trial
delay
All core devs
â€¢ All core devs â€“ consensus (ACDC) #137 : Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade : Pectra-devnet-1 : aim to launch next week EIP7594 PeerDAS :
peerdas-devnet-2 launching early next week with fixes from previous devnet Decouple layers for blob count: max blob check on execution
layer is redundant & can be removed, proposal for target blob count to be driven by consensus layer (needs to be included in execution
layer block header) Fork choice compliance testing presentation, model based test generation, test suite run with Teku
â€¢ Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade : Pectra-devnet-1 : aim to launch next week EIP7594 PeerDAS : peerdas-devnet-2 launching early next
week with fixes from previous devnet Decouple layers for blob count: max blob check on execution layer is redundant & can be removed,
proposal for target blob count to be driven by consensus layer (needs to be included in execution layer block header)
Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade :
â€¢ Pectra-devnet-1 : aim to launch next week
Pectra-devnet-1 : aim to launch next week
â€¢ EIP7594 PeerDAS : peerdas-devnet-2 launching early next week with fixes from previous devnet Decouple layers for blob count: max blob
check on execution layer is redundant & can be removed, proposal for target blob count to be driven by consensus layer (needs to be
included in execution layer block header)
EIP7594 PeerDAS :
â€¢ peerdas-devnet-2 launching early next week with fixes from previous devnet
peerdas-devnet-2 launching early next week with fixes from previous devnet
â€¢ Decouple layers for blob count: max blob check on execution layer is redundant & can be removed, proposal for target blob count to be
driven by consensus layer (needs to be included in execution layer block header)
Decouple layers for blob count: max blob check on execution layer is redundant & can be removed, proposal for target blob count to be
â€¢ Fork choice compliance testing presentation, model based test generation, test suite run with Teku
Fork choice compliance testing presentation, model based test generation, test suite run with Teku
Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade, likely targeting Q1 2025
â€¢ Marius Van Der Wijden: case against EOF in Pectra
Marius Van Der Wijden: case against EOF in Pectra
â€¢ PeerDAS breakout #3 : Relaunch devnet with client fixes, proposal to use custody groups instead of subnets to decouple core & network
layers and agreed consensus layer should send max & target blob counts in execution layer header
PeerDAS breakout #3 :
â€¢ Relaunch devnet with client fixes, proposal to use custody groups instead of subnets to decouple core & network layers and agreed
consensus layer should send max & target blob counts in execution layer header
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
â€¢ ðŸš¨ Lido at 29% , still too close to 33.3% threshold
ðŸš¨ Lido at 29% , still too close to 33.3% threshold
â€¢ Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth ~55% majority Consensus layer: Prysm 37% Any client bug over 33.3%
could mean loss of finality
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
â€¢ Execution layer: Geth ~55% majority
Execution layer: Geth ~55% majority
â€¢ Consensus layer: Prysm 37%
Consensus layer: Prysm 37%
â€¢ Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
â€¢ Better geographic diversity is optimal, particularly outside of North America & Europe
Better geographic diversity is optimal, particularly outside of North America & Europe
Layer 1
â€¢ Toni WahrstÃ¤tter: attestations analysis , node operator performance, best/worst validators, big block & blob impact and proposer timing
games
Toni WahrstÃ¤tter: attestations analysis , node operator performance, best/worst validators, big block & blob impact and proposer timing
â€¢ Data Always: censorship resistance proposal , limit missed proposer income & increase localBlockValueBoost
Data Always: censorship resistance proposal , limit missed proposer income & increase localBlockValueBoost
â€¢ Constantine v0.1 : implementations of BLS signatures, BN254 & BLS12-381 precompiles and KZG polynomial commitments for blobs; bindings
in C, Go, Nim & Rust
Constantine v0.1 : implementations of BLS signatures, BN254 & BLS12-381 precompiles and KZG polynomial commitments for blobs; bindings in
C, Go, Nim & Rust
â€¢ PÃ©ter SzilÃ¡gyi: SSZ library implemented in Go
PÃ©ter SzilÃ¡gyi: SSZ library implemented in Go
Research
â€¢ Anders Elowsson: dynamic pricing auction of execution proposal rights , induces less new MEV & produces high aggregate MEV burn
Client Releases
â€¢ Consensus layer: Lodestar v1.20.0 : lodestar/api package changes exported types, flag to use SSZ APIs with validator client and testnet
bootnode ENRs updated
Consensus layer:
â€¢ Lodestar v1.20.0 : lodestar/api package changes exported types, flag to use SSZ APIs with validator client and testnet bootnode ENRs
updated
â€¢ Execution layer: Besu v24.7.0 : adds eth_maxPriorityFeePerGas support and improvements to sync, peering & startup performance Erigon
v2.60.3 : adds optional include precompiles flag to tracing Geth v1.14.7 : hotfix for concurrent map read/write bug in v1.14.6 Reth v1.0.1
: full node performance improvements, ExEx backfill & RPC fixes
Execution layer:
â€¢ Besu v24.7.0 : adds eth_maxPriorityFeePerGas support and improvements to sync, peering & startup performance
Besu v24.7.0 : adds eth_maxPriorityFeePerGas support and improvements to sync, peering & startup performance
â€¢ Erigon v2.60.3 : adds optional include precompiles flag to tracing
Erigon v2.60.3 : adds optional include precompiles flag to tracing
â€¢ Geth v1.14.7 : hotfix for concurrent map read/write bug in v1.14.6
Geth v1.14.7 : hotfix for concurrent map read/write bug in v1.14.6
â€¢ Reth v1.0.1
Reth v1.0.1
For Stakers
â€¢ Stereum v2.2 : multi-setup support and connection check to test network stability & connectivity
Layer 2
â€¢ OP Stack Fjord upgrade , cheaper smart wallet passkey verification via RIP7212 secp256r1 precompile and 5-15% lower data availability
costs via Brotli channel compression
OP Stack Fjord upgrade , cheaper smart wallet passkey verification via RIP7212 secp256r1 precompile and 5-15% lower data availability
â€¢ RollCall (L2 standards) #6 : L1 blob basefee spike on June 20 discussion and presentations on RIP7728 L1SLOAD precompile & RIP7740
preinstall deterministic deployment factories
RollCall (L2 standards) #6 :
â€¢ L1 blob basefee spike on June 20 discussion and presentations on RIP7728 L1SLOAD precompile & RIP7740 preinstall deterministic
deployment factories
â€¢ Titan Builder eth_sendBlobs : send permutations of blob transactions from a single sender
Titan Builder eth_sendBlobs : send permutations of blob transactions from a single sender
EIPs/Standards
â€¢ EIPs (Ethereum improvement proposals): EIP7742 : Uncouple blob count between CL and EL
EIPs (Ethereum improvement proposals):
â€¢ EIP7742 : Uncouple blob count between CL and EL
â€¢ RIPs (rollup improvement proposals): RIP7740 : Preinstall deterministic deployment factories
RIPs (rollup improvement proposals):
â€¢ RIP7740 : Preinstall deterministic deployment factories
â€¢ ERCs (application layer standards): ERC7737 : Custom data access model ERC7738 : Permissionless script registry ERC7739 : Readable typed
signatures for smart accounts ERC7741 : Authorize operator (via EIP712 secp256k1 signatures)

â€¢ ERC7737 : Custom data access model
ERC7737 : Custom data access model

ERC7738 : Permissionless script registry

EIP.tools adds EIP-GPT, AI generated summary of an EIP/ERC
Stuff for developers
â€¢ Web-solc : adapter to fetch/run specific version of Solidity compiler in the browser
Web-solc : adapter to fetch/run specific version of Solidity compiler in the browser

Nethermind Clear : formal verification framework for Yul code

Byteracing : maze solver in Solidity, try to make it more gas efficient
Security
â€¢ Dough Finance $2M exploit via unvalidated calldata
Ecosystem

admission wave 1 July 16 Speaker & volunteer applications are open Bangkok city guide

July 16

Job Listings

Marketing Officer

Aragon: Senior Smart Contract Developer

Onchain stats
â€¢ Fees (via ultrasound.money ): Gas: 1.0 to 28.6 gwei, 3.6 gwei average; zero net issuance at 23.5 gwei 15k ETH net issuance this week

15k ETH net issuance this week
â€¢ ETHUSD : $2,866 - $3,185, currently $3,133, all time high $4,878
ETHUSD : $2,866 - $3,185, currently $3,133, all time high $4,878
â€¢ ETHBTC : currently 0.054 (Flippening at ~0.164)
ETHBTC : currently 0.054 (Flippening at ~0.164)
Notable at app layer
â€¢ Multiple domains registered with Squarespace compromised including Compound Labs & Celer : Google Domains users migrated to Squarespace
should enable 2FA & remove excess contributor accounts
Multiple domains registered with Squarespace compromised including Compound Labs & Celer :
â€¢ Google Domains users migrated to Squarespace should enable 2FA & remove excess contributor accounts
â€¢ Fileverse dDocs : browser based word processor, end to end encrypted
Fileverse dDocs : browser based word processor, end to end encrypted
Regulation/business/tokens
â€¢ SEC formally notifies Paxos that it will not be charged for BUSD
SEC formally notifies Paxos that it will not be charged for BUSD
â€¢ SEC Staff Accounting Bulletin 121 : SEC allows some exceptions to balance sheet reporting, House failed to overturn Presidential veto of
repeal
SEC Staff Accounting Bulletin 121 : SEC allows some exceptions to balance sheet reporting, House failed to overturn Presidential veto of
â€¢ Republican party adopts very pro-crypto platform
Republican party adopts very pro-crypto platform
â€¢ Alex Pertsev denied bail to prepare for appeal
Alex Pertsev denied bail to prepare for appeal
â€¢ Roman Storm granted trial delay until December
Roman Storm granted trial delay until December
General
â€¢ Tayvano: example of a Lazarus attack , contact via socials and then compromise via GitHub repo
Tayvano: example of a Lazarus attack , contact via socials and then compromise via GitHub repo
â€¢ AT&T breach , data includes records of calls & texts of nearly all customers
AT&T breach , data includes records of calls & texts of nearly all customers
â€¢ Signal desktop stores decryption key in plain text file, encryption work started after backlash
Signal desktop stores decryption key in plain text file, encryption work started after backlash
